titlestmt.titleproper: American Posters from the World Wars
titlestmt.author: Collection guide written by Jean Luddy.
titlestmt.sponsor: This project was made possible in part through a grant from the Institute of Museum and Library Services to the Connecticut State Library on behalf of the State Archives and Conservation ConneCTion.

titlepage.publisher:
Vernon Historical Society
734 Hartford Turnpike
Vernon, CT 06066
titlepage.p: This project was made possible in part through a grant from the Institute of Museum and Library Services to the Connecticut State Library on behalf of the State Archives and Conservation ConneCTion.
© 2018 Vernon Historical Society. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: American Posters from the World Wars
did.abstract: The collection contains posters created during World War I and World War II for display on the Home Front. Themes include encouraging the purchase of war bonds, supporting those in battle and suggesting ways that people at home could help the war effort.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Vernon Historical Society.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], , [Box no]., Vernon Historical Society

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Many of these posters were collected by Stephen Von Euw during World War II and were part of the collection left to the Vernon Historical Society by his daughter. The rest of the posters came to the Society from individual donors over the years.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: A small number of the posters have been encapsulated in mylar for display.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The posters were collected by people from Vernon and Rockville during both World Wars. Most of the World War II posters came from the Von Euw collection. As editor of The Rockville Journal during the war, Mr. Von Euw received posters from different government agencies. Mindful of their value as history and art, he saved them after the war.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection of posters were published during World War I and World War II. The intended audience was the American public. Themes of the posters include promoting the sale of war bonds to finance the war, encouraging enlistment into the armed forces, encouraging support for the war effort, warning the public about hidden dangers and educating them about strategies to assist in the war effort. The posters vary in size. Many have illustrations in color. Several artists of note designed some of the posters. This collection reveals how the wars were presented to the public. In addition to being works of art, the posters show use of color and imagery presented in graphic style to stir the emotions as well as educate the public to the challenges of wartime.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is stored in two drawers within a flat file cabinet. The posters are arranged in the order that they were accessioned.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1917-1918- Connecticut- Rockville
World War, 1917-1918- Connecticut- Vernon
World War, 1917-1918- Posters
World War, 1939-1945- Connecticut- Rockville
World War,1939-1945- Connecticut- Vernon
World War,1939-1945- Posters
Von Euw, Stephen, 1896-1955
The Rockville Journal, Rockville, Connecticut
Posters

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Some of the posters were part of the Von Euw collection which includes letters and correspondence from those in military service and documents and letters to and from Mr. Von Euw during World War II.
